NODE_NAME.question: Node Name
NODE_NAME.description: Unique name for the AnyLog node

ANYLOG_SERVER_PORT.question: TCP Server Port
ANYLOG_SERVER_PORT.description: Port for TCP communication between nodes

ANYLOG_REST_PORT.question: REST Server Port
ANYLOG_REST_PORT.description: Port for REST communication with the node

ANYLOG_BROKER_PORT.question: MQTT Message Broker Port
ANYLOG_BROKER_PORT.description: Message Broker Port for the node

LOCAL_IP.question: Local IP
LOCAL_IP.description: Local IP of the machine - if running on Kubernetes this value will be set as the Proxy IP

SYNC_TIME.question: Frequency to Sync with Master Node
SYNC_TIME.description: How often to sync against the blockchain

SOURCE.description: Source of where the data is coming from

DESTINATION.description: Where will the copy of the blockchain be stored

DEPLOY_SYSTEM_QUERY.question: Deploy system_query logical database
DEPLOY_SYSTEM_QUERY.description: Whether to automatically deploy system_query logical database on node - enabled by default on Query node

MEMORY.question: Run system_query in memory
MEMORY.description: Run system_query logical database in memory

CLUSTER_NAME.question: Cluster Name
CLUSTER_NAME.description: Name of the cluster operator will be associated with

DATABASE_NAME.question: Logical Database Name
DATABASE_NAME.description: Logical database to store data coming into operator node

ENABLE_PARTITIONS.question: Enable Partitions
ENABLE_PARTITIONS.description: whether or not to partition data on node

PARTITION_INTERVAL.question: Partition Intervals
PARTITION_INTERVAL.description: Amount of time to partition by

PARTITION_KEEP.question: How many partitions to keep
PARTITION_KEEP.description: Number of partitioned tables to keep

PARTITION_SYNC.question: How often to remove extra partitions
PARTITION_SYNC.description: How often to check / remove old paritions

MEMBER.description: Operator member ID - by default it's autogenerated, should be set only when resetting blockchain, but want to keep exactly the same information

CREATE_TABLE.description: creates a table if the table doesn't exists

UPDATE_TSD.description: update a summary table (tsd_info table in almgm dbms) with status of files ingested. (by default, almgm database & tsd_info table get created on all operator nodes)

DISTRIBUTOR.description: Transfer data files to members of the cluster

MOVE_JSON.description: Backup JSON files in publisher after distributing them to operator node(s)

DB_LOCATION.description: In JSON file name, the location of the logical database to store file in (ex. [db_name].[file_name].0.json)

TABLE_LOCATION.description: In JSON file name, the location of the logical table name to store data in (ex. [db_name].[file_name].0.json)

ENABLE_MQTT.question: Do you want to enable MQTT client
ENABLE_MQTT.description: Whether or not to enable MQTT client process

MQTT_LOG.question: Enable `run mqtt client` log
MQTT_LOG.description: Whether or not to output the broekr log messages to screen

MQTT_TOPIC_DBMS.question: Logical database Name to store data in
MQTT_TOPIC_DBMS.description: Logical database to store data coming from MQTT client

MQTT_TABLE_NAME.question: Table to store data in
MQTT_TABLE_NAME.description: Physical table to store data in

MQTT_COLUMN_VALUE.question: Value Column Name
MQTT_COLUMN_VALUE.description: How to extract value from data coming in

TCP_THREAD_POOL.description: number of workers threads that process requests which are send to the provided IP and Port.

REST_TIMEOUT.description: Amount of time (in seconds) until REST timeout

REST_THREADS.description: The number of concurrent threads supporting HTTP requests.

OPERATOR_POOL.description: Sets the number of threads supporting queries (the default is 3).

WRITE_IMMEDIATE.description: Local database is immediate (independent of the calls to flush)

THRESHOLD_TIME.description: The time threshold to flush the streaming data

Threshold Size.description: The accumulated data volume that calls the data flush process
